revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1989 |Team=Indiana Hoosiers |Image= |Conference=Big Ten Conference |ShortConference=Big Ten |Record= 5-6 |ConfRecord=3-5 |CoachRank= |APRank= |HeadCoach=[[Bill Mallory]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Memorial Stadium, Bloomington|Memorial Stadium]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} {{1989 Big Ten football standings}} The '''1989 Indiana Hoosiers football team''' represented the [[University of Indiana]] in the [[1989 NCAA Division I-A football season]].
==Season== ===Rivalries=== *In the battle for the [[Old Oaken Bucket]], Purdue beat Indiana.
===Schedule=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#990000;color:#FFFFCC;" | '''Game''' || '''Date''' || '''Opponent''' || '''Result''' || '''Hoosiers points''' || '''Opponents''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 1 ||Sept. 9 || @ [[1989 Kentucky Wildcats football team|Kentucky]] || Loss || 14 || 17 ||0-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2 || Sept. 16|| {{cfb link|year=1989|team=Missouri Tigers|title=Missouri}} || Win || 24 || 7 || 1-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 3 ||Sept. 30 || {{cfb link|year=1989|team=Toledo Rockets|title=Toledo}} || Win || 32 || 12 ||2-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 4 || Oct. 7|| {{cfb link|year=1989|team=Northwestern Wildcats|title=Northwestern}} || Win || 43 || 11 || 3-1 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 5 || Oct. 14|| @ [[1989 Ohio State Buckeyes football team|Ohio State]] || Loss || 31 || 35 || 3-2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 6 || Oct. 21|| [[1989 Minnesota Golden Gophers football team|Minnesota]] || Win || 28 || 18 || 4-2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 7|| Oct. 28|| @ [[1989 Michigan Wolverines football team|Michigan]] || Loss || 10 || 38 || 4-3 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 8|| Nov. 4|| [[1989 Michigan State Spartans football team|Michigan State]] || Loss || 20 || 51 || 4-4 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 9|| Nov. 11|| @ [[1989 Wisconsin Badgers football team|Wisconsin]] || Win || 45||17 ||5-4 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 10|| Nov. 18|| @ [[1989 Illinois Fighting Illini football team|Illinois]] || Loss ||28 ||41 ||5-5 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 11|| Nov. 25|| {{cfb link|year=1989|team=Purdue Boilermakers|title=Purdue}} || Loss || 14||15 ||5-6 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}<ref>http://cfreference.net/cfr/school.s?id=117&season=1989</ref>
===Highlights=== *Nov. 4, 1989: [[Anthony Thompson (American football)|Anthony Thompson]] scores his 60th career touchdown to set a then NCAA Division I-A record.
*Nov. 11, 1989: The NCAA single-game rushing record of 357 yards, held by [[Rueben Mayes]] and [[Mike Pringle (Canadian football)|Mike Pringle]] is broken as Anthony Thompson rushes for 377 yards in a 45-17 victory at Wisconsin. Thompson also scores four touchdowns on the day.
*Nov. 24, 1989: Anthony Thompson was the top vote-getter and the only repeat selection on the 1989 Walter Camp All-America team. Thompson finished the season with 1,793 yards and 24 touchdowns.
*Dec. 2, 1989: A chorus of boos is heard throughout the [[Hoosier Dome]] during the Indiana-Kentucky basketball game. It is announced that [[Andre Ware]] of the [[1989 Houston Cougars football team|Houston Cougars]] is the 55th recipient of the [[Heisman Trophy]]. Anthony Thompson finishes second.<ref>http://www.collegefootballhistory.com/hoosiers/history.htm</ref>
==Team players in the NFL== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#990000;color:#FFFFCC;" | '''Player''' || '''Position''' || '''Round''' || '''Pick''' || '''NFL Club''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | [[Anthony Thompson (American football)|Anthony Thompson]]||Running Back|| 2 ||31 || [[1990 Phoenix Cardinals season|Arizona Cardinals]] |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Ian Beckles||Guard|| 5 ||114|| [[1990 Tampa Bay Buccaneers season|Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}<ref>http://www.pro-football-reference.com/draft/1990.htm </ref>
*[[Trent Green]] joined the NFL in 1997 with the [[Washington Redskins]].<ref> http://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/G/GreeTr00.htm</ref>
==Awards and honors== *[[Anthony Thompson (American football)|Anthony Thompson]], Big Ten Player of the Year *Anthony Thompson, [[Chicago Tribune Silver Football]] *Anthony Thompson, [[Walter Camp Award]] *Anthony Thompson, [[Maxwell Award]]
